DOC.brief_summary: We study blood sugars in the children with T1DM, who are given insulin detemir and a rapid acting insulin. We hypothesize that there is no difference in the patterns of blood sugars when detemir is given in the same syringe or in separate syringes with rapid acting insulin.
DOC.criteria: Subjects with antibody positive T1DM On insulin glargine for at least 3 months Age 1025 years Not on medications that may affect glucose concentrations HbA1C of less than 9 % BMI less than 95th % and more than 10th% Supportive family Subjects with undetermined diabetes or T2DM Unable to adhere to insulin regimen Positive urine pregnancy test
